comment: AVOID AT ALL COSTS! This class was very expensive (100$+) and required lots of crunch. The first of two projects took about 40hrs a week for 2.5 months, with unrealistic deadlines. Attendance w/ massive hw was a must, need a big car. She was unprofessional, trying to humiliate/pressure students and fought w other profs. Final was writing 20+ pages.

During the critics, we were supposed to go over vocabulary words that we didn't even discuss in class. It's like we were expected to remember vocab from 2D, even though a lil recap as a class would've been nice. 

For a foundation course, she made it extremely difficult for no reason and multiple people cried in class because of the stress.

I am the person who said she was nice and funny. Welp I totally lied. She was nice and funny at the beginning of the semester, but over time I saw her true colors as a professor. Which is UNPROFESSIONAL, PASSIVE AGGRESSIVE, and workload heavy. After I withdrew from the class, I came by to say hey to my old classmates and she kicked me out.
Ridiculously time consuming class for a foundation. Lots of homework if you want to pass with good grade.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Do NOT take her. Take anyone else. She WILL overwork you with overambitious projects and tight deadlines. You will also *not* be taught the relevant concepts because she only makes those known right before critique. She is also highly unprofessional and does not like giving in-progress feedback. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.
Get ready for a heavy work load,  more than 6 hours of homework. The projects include a giant puppet, ceramics and final documentation. Very time consuming class.

If you are an art major in need of a 3D design course. DON'T TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. She will assign you to create a giant parade puppet. It's a lot of work, and she expects us to complete certain aspects by a certain time, which is time-consuming given that we have other assignments in other classes.  She is nice and funny, but be fully aware.

i found her a little rude and passive aggressive. a lot of her criteria was unclear with not very good instruction in person or on d2l. i was nervous to ask questions. i did start to like the class more about halfway through. the projects were often tedious and difficult, which wasn't always a bad thing, but definitely a time consuming class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: The semester has ended, and I still haven't received my finalized grade. During the whole semester, she was very rude to students and condescending when we asked basic questions and asked for clarification on things because most instructions she gave were extremely vague and confusing.

Professor Swan is a great teacher. For it to be her first semester here she is doing great especially understanding the workload for her students. I have learn a lot of new art styles in her class. We do almost a new project/art subject every 2-3 weeks depending on difficulty. Overall great class for learning new things and experimentation.

I took Swan's 2D Design & Color theory class in Fall 2024, which was her first semester at KSU. The criteria for the projects is very clear, and it's not hard to get an A in this class as long as you put in the time and effort in your projects. Swan gives good feedback on projects and makes a clear effort to connect with students.

It was her first semester here as it was mine, and she did a very good job connecting with her students in class!  Her projects are pretty straight forward as long as you spend the time and extra care into them, and a she is a pretty fairly easy grader. Attendance is mandatory, but it is worth it because she makes it fun in my opinion.
